result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles L Smith

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Charles L Smith in court.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
State places offer on the record.
Defendant requests time to find representation.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:51 AM Defendant Charles L Smith in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant requests time to hire an attorney as he does not qualify for the public defender. 
State places offer on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is able to possess firearms for the purpose of obtaining his CCW certificate.

01:45 PM Defendant Charles L Smith in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
